front.title: Interoperable Domain Name System (DNS) Server Cookies

abstract.t: DNS cookies, as specified in RFC 7873, are a lightweight DNS transaction security mechanism that provides limited protection to DNS servers and clients against a variety of denial-of-service and amplification, forgery, or cache poisoning attacks by off-path attackers. This document provides precise directions for creating Server Cookies so that an anycast server set including diverse implementations will interoperate with standard clients. This document updates [RFC7873]
